original: Jacobsson, Axel Emil, redaktör, Göteborg, f. 29/10/87 i Gbg av Axel Wilhelm J. o. Maria Elisabet Noling. G. 13 m. Ester Teresia Torstenson. Barn: Barbro f. 20, Sten 22, Ulla 23. — Studiex. v. Gbgs latin 08, stud. v. Gbgs högsk. Res. i Skandinav, samt t. Tyskl. o. Tjeckoslo v. Medarb. i Sv. Telegr :byråns red :filial i Gbg 08-17, i Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. fr. 17, dess korresp. i Berhn 20-24, chef f. dess Sthlmskont. 27-37, utr:red. i Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. sed. 40. Led. av styr. f. Sv. journ:fören. Gbgskrets 14-19 o. Sthlms-krets 31-35, v. ordf. i des’s centr : styr. 34, ordf. 37-47, ordf. i Publ:kl. v. krets 42-45, led. av tryckfrih :ndn 40-45, ordf. i förb. Kämpande demokrati 44-46 o. i Nord. journ:förb. 47, led. av pressens opi-nionsnd 37-38 o. sed. 46 samt av Sv. tidn :utg :fören. o. Sv. journ:fören. förtr :nd sed. 37. Dagl. kommenterat den utr :pO’lit. situationen i Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. sed. 40. Sign.: Jc. Norska FrK.
translated: Jacobsson, Axel Emil, editor, Gothenburg, born on October 29, 1887 in Gothenburg to Axel Wilhelm J. and Maria Elisabet Noling. Married on the 13th of an unknown month with Ester Teresia Torstenson. Children: Barbro, born in 1920, Sten in 1922, Ulla in 1923. Completed secondary education at Gothenburg Latin School in 1908, studied at Gothenburg University. Resided in Scandinavia, Germany, and Czechoslovakia. Collaborated with the Swedish Telegraph Agency's Gothenburg branch from 1908 to 1917. Worked for Gothenburg's Trade and Maritime Newspaper from 1917, and its correspondent in Berlin from 1920 to 1924. Head of its Stockholm office from 1927 to 1937, and foreign editor since 1940. Member of the board for the Swedish Journalist Association's Gothenburg district from 1914 to 1919 and Stockholm district from 1931 to 1935. Vice-chairman of the central board in 1934, chairman from 1937 to 1947. Chairman of the Publicity Club in his district from 1942 to 1945. Member of the Press Freedom Commission from 1940 to 1945. Chairman of the Fighting Democracy Association from 1944 to 1946, and the Nordic Journalist Association from 1947. Member of the Press Opinion Commission from 1937 to 1938 and since 1946, as well as the Swedish Publishers Association and the Swedish Journalist Association's representative body since 1937. Provided daily commentary on the political situation in Gothenburg's Trade and Maritime Newspaper since 1940. Signature: Jc. Norwegian FrK.

structured.name: Axel Emil Jacobsson
structured.comment: He provided daily commentary on the political situation in Gothenburg's Trade and Maritime Newspaper.
